module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/exercise-1-.title: Exercise 1 - Basic Nodes, Topics, and Services
module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/exercise-1-.description: In this exercise, you'll create your first ROS 2 nodes, implement publisher/subscriber communication, and create a simple service. This will solidify your understanding of the fundamental ROS 2 concepts.

module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/index.title: Chapter 1 - Fundamentals of ROS 2 Nodes, Topics, and Services
module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/index.description: Welcome to the fundamentals of ROS 2! This chapter will introduce you to the core concepts that make up the Robot Operating System 2 (ROS 2) middleware.

module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/introductio.title: Introduction to ROS 2 Concepts
module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/introductio.description: This introduction covers the foundational concepts of ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2) that you'll need to understand before diving deeper into the educational module. ROS 2 is a flexible framework for writing robot software, providing services designed for a heterogeneous computer cluster.

module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/setup.title: ROS 2 Installation and Environment Setup
module-1-ros2/chapter-1-ros2/setup.description: This guide will help you set up your ROS 2 environment for the educational module. Follow these steps to ensure your system is properly configured for ROS 2 development.

module-1-ros2/chapter-2-python-agents/ex.title: Exercise 2 - Python Agent Integration with ROS 2
module-1-ros2/chapter-2-python-agents/ex.description: In this exercise, you'll create a Python-based AI agent that integrates with ROS 2 systems using the rclpy library. You'll implement sensor data processing and control command publishing to bridge the gap between AI software and robotics hardware.

module-1-ros2/chapter-2-python-agents/in.title: Chapter 2 - Integrating Python Agents with ROS 2 via rclpy
module-1-ros2/chapter-2-python-agents/in.description: This chapter focuses on integrating Python-based AI agents with ROS 2 systems using the rclpy library. You'll learn how to bridge the gap between AI software and robotics hardware.

module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/co.title: Complete ROS 2 Integration - All Concepts Combined
module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/co.description: This document demonstrates how all three chapters work together in a complete ROS 2 system. We'll show how ROS 2 fundamentals, Python agent integration, and URDF modeling concepts integrate to create a functional robotic system.

module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/ex.title: Exercise 3 - Humanoid Robot Modeling with URDF
module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/ex.description: In this exercise, you'll create your own humanoid robot model using URDF (Unified Robot Description Format). You'll learn how to define links, joints, and materials to create a complete robot model that can be visualized and simulated.

module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/fi.title: Module Summary - The Robotic Nervous System
module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/fi.description: Congratulations! You've completed the comprehensive module on "The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)". This module covered three essential areas of ROS 2 development for robotics applications.

module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/in.title: Chapter 3 - Modeling Humanoid Robots with URDF
module-1-ros2/chapter-3-urdf-modeling/in.description: This chapter covers the Unified Robot Description Format (URDF), which is an XML format for representing robot models including kinematics and dynamics. You'll learn how to model humanoid robots for simulation and control.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/c.title: Chapter 1 Citations and References
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/c.description: This document provides citations to official Gazebo and ROS documentation referenced throughout Chapter 1 - Physics Simulation in Gazebo. These sources provide authoritative information on the concepts and techniques covered in this chapter.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/d.title: Diagrams and Screenshots Guide
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/d.description: This document describes the diagrams and screenshots that should be included in the Gazebo physics simulation chapter to enhance learning and understanding. These visual aids provide clarity to complex concepts and help learners visualize the setup and configuration processes.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/e.title: Exercise 1 - Basic Robot in Gazebo Environment

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/g.title: Gazebo Plugins and Custom Environments Code Examples
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/g.description: This section provides practical code examples for creating custom Gazebo plugins and building specialized simulation environments. These examples demonstrate advanced techniques for extending Gazebo's capabilities in digital twin applications.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/g.title: Gazebo Setup Guide for Physics Simulation
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/g.description: This guide provides comprehensive instructions for installing and setting up Gazebo specifically for physics simulation in digital twin applications. We'll cover the installation process, configuration, and verification steps needed to create realistic physics simulations.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/i.title: Chapter 1 - Physics Simulation in Gazebo
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/i.description: Welcome to Chapter 1 of the Digital Twin educational module! This chapter focuses on Gazebo physics simulation, which forms the foundational component of our digital twin system. Gazebo provides realistic physics simulation that accurately models the behavior of robots and their interactions with the environment.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/t.title: Troubleshooting Guide for Common Gazebo Issues
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-1-gazebo/t.description: This comprehensive troubleshooting guide addresses common issues encountered when working with Gazebo for digital twin applications. The guide is organized by issue category with detailed solutions and preventive measures.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/di.title: Unity Setup Diagrams and Screenshots Guide
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/di.description: This document describes the diagrams and screenshots that should be included in the Unity visualization chapter to enhance learning and understanding. These visual aids provide clarity to complex concepts and help learners visualize the setup and configuration processes.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/in.title: Chapter 2 - High-Fidelity Rendering in Unity
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/in.description: Welcome to Chapter 2 of the Digital Twin educational module! This chapter focuses on Unity for high-fidelity rendering and visualization, which provides the visual component of our digital twin system. Unity enables realistic rendering of robot models, environments, and human-robot interactions that complement the physics simulation provided by Gazebo.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/ma.title: Realistic Material and Lighting Setup for Robots
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/ma.description: This section provides comprehensive guidance on creating realistic materials and lighting setups for robot visualization in Unity. Proper material and lighting configuration is essential for high-fidelity digital twin rendering that accurately represents real-world robot appearance and behavior.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/op.title: Optimization Techniques for High-Fidelity Rendering
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/op.description: This section provides comprehensive optimization techniques for achieving high-fidelity rendering in Unity while maintaining real-time performance for digital twin applications. These techniques balance visual quality with computational efficiency.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/ro.title: Robot Model Import and Setup Tutorial
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/ro.description: This tutorial provides comprehensive guidance on importing and setting up robot models in Unity for digital twin applications. You'll learn how to bring 3D robot models into Unity, configure them for visualization, and prepare them for integration with robotics systems.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.title: Unity Documentation Citations
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.description: This document provides citations to official Unity documentation and robotics packages used in the digital twin visualization chapter. These references support the technical content and provide additional resources for learners.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.title: Unity Installation and Setup for Robotics
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.description: This guide provides comprehensive instructions for installing and setting up Unity specifically for robotics visualization and digital twin applications. We'll cover the installation process, robotics-specific packages, and configuration needed for high-fidelity rendering.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.title: Unity-ROS Integration Code Examples
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/un.description: This section provides comprehensive code examples for integrating Unity with ROS (Robot Operating System) for digital twin applications. These examples demonstrate how to establish communication between Unity and ROS systems, enabling real-time data exchange for visualization and control.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/us.title: User Interface Controls for Robot Interaction
module-2-digital-twin/chapter-2-unity/us.description: This section provides comprehensive guidance on creating intuitive user interfaces for interacting with robot digital twins in Unity. Effective UI design is crucial for operators to monitor, control, and understand robot behavior in the digital twin environment.

module-2-digital-twin/chapter-3-sensors/.title: Chapter 3 - Sensor Simulation in Digital Twins

module-2-digital-twin/integration-guide.title: Integration Guide - Connecting Gazebo and Unity

module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-2-isaac-.title: Diagrams and Visuals for Isaac ROS
Chapter 2: Isaac ROS - Hardware-Accelerated VSLAM and Navigation
Isaac ROS Installation and Setup Guide
Chapter 2 Summary: Isaac ROS for Humanoid Navigation

module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-3-nav2-h.title: Humanoid-Specific Configuration
module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-3-nav2-h.description: This document details the configuration parameters and settings required to adapt the Navigation2 framework for humanoid robots. Unlike wheeled robots, humanoid robots have unique kinematic and dynamic constraints that must be considered in the navigation system.

module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-3-nav2-h.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 - Humanoid Path Planning
module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-3-nav2-h.description: This chapter covers the Navigation2 (Nav2) framework specifically tailored for humanoid robots. We'll explore how to adapt traditional wheeled robot navigation approaches for bipedal locomotion and complex humanoid movement patterns.

module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-3-nav2-h.title: Nav2 Installation and Setup Guide for Humanoid Applications

module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.title: Voice-to-Action - Using OpenAI Whisper for Voice Commands
module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.description: Learn how to implement voice-to-action systems using OpenAI Whisper for robotic applications

module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.title: Cognitive Planning - Using LLMs to Translate Natural Language into ROS 2 Actions
module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.description: Learn how to use Large Language Models for cognitive planning in robotics, translating natural language into ROS 2 actions

module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.title: Capstone Project - The Autonomous Humanoid
module-4-vla-educational-module/chapter-.description: Integrate voice-to-action and cognitive planning in a complete VLA system for an autonomous humanoid robot
